The paper deals with the problem of universal decoding, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the construction of a universal metric, which is a mathematical object that is commonly studied in information theory and probability theory (cs.ITP). The paper's focus on decoding and metrics suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-categories of multimedia (cs.MM) and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper's use of sub-exponential analysis and optimization techniques suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG).
